title: Old Fashioned Butter Valentine Cookies Dipped in Chocolate

instructions.1: Sift the flour, baking powder, and salt together in a bowl; set aside.
instructions.2: Beat the 1 cup butter with the sugar, egg, milk, and vanilla extract in another bowl until well mixed.
instructions.3: Gradually mix the flour mixture into the butter mixture.
instructions.4: Shape the dough into a disk; wrap with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
instructions.5: Working with half the dough at a time, roll out dough to about 1/8-inch thick.
instructions.6: Cut into cookies with a large heart shaped cookie cutter. Repeat with the remaining half of the dough.
instructions.7: Cut the center of half of the cookies with a smaller heart shaped cookie cutter.
instructions.8: Place an open centered cookie on top of a whole cookie to form a sandwich. Arrange cookies on an ungreased baking sheet; set aside.
instructions.9: Preheat an oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
instructions.10: Place the raspberry jam in a microwave save bowl and heat on high until jam is runny, about 35 seconds.
instructions.11: Fill the center of the cookies with the jam. Refrigerate cookies for 10 minutes.
instructions.12: Bake in the preheated oven until the cookies are firm to the touch, 5 to 8 minutes. Cookies will be pale in color.
instructions.13: Transfer cookies to a wire rack to cool completely.
instructions.14: Melt the chocolate and 2 tablespoons butter in a microwave-safe glass or ceramic bowl in 30-second intervals, stirring after each melting until smooth, for 1 to 3 minutes, depending on your microwave.
instructions.15: Spoon chocolate decoratively over half of each cookie.
instructions.16: Place cookie on a waxed paper lined baking sheet and refrigerate until the chocolate has set, about 15 minutes.

questions.question: In Step 12, is the oven from Step 9 being used?
